DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of the study is to investigate pain, anxiety and depression in chronic pain patients with and without neuropathic pain compared with healthy volunteers
DOC.brief_title: Descriptive Study of Pain, Anxiety and Depression
DOC.detailed_description: Primary outcome measures: - Symptom checklist 92 Secondary outcome measures: - Hamilton Depression and Anxiety Rating Scale - Major Depression Inventory - GAD-10 Anxiety Scale - Health Survey SF-36 - McGill Pain Questionnaire - Sweat test - Heart rate variability testing - Coping Strategy Questionnare - Quantitative sensory testing - Pain Catastrophizing Scale - Pain rating (VAS) - Interview
DOC.criteria: Neuropathic pain patient or patient with fibromyalgia Daily pain in more than 6 months Weekly average pain score 4 or more (VAS) Treatment with antidepressants, anticonvulsants or any other pain medication except paracetamol Serious or unstable medical disease Prior or present diagnosis of mania, bipolar or psychotic disorder, delirium, suicidal, drug and alcohol dependence, severe agitation Patients who cannot cooperate and do not understand Danish
